newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka eases on higher dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka eases on higher dollar demand.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka lost early gains and closed slightly easier at 42.5485/5500 to the dollar in interbank trading against the previous 42.5480/5500, dealers said.
Dealers said the local unit opened firmer at 42.5460/5500 but slipped on higher demand for the U.S. currency from importers.
The interbank call money rates ended unchanged at 4.0 to 4.75 percent, dealers said.
